participant_1.name: Michael
participant_1.personality: Empathetic and caring, Michael often puts others' needs before his own. He uses humor to cope with stress but feels the weight of responsibility during tough times.
participant_1.background: I want to learn how to be a better support to my wife during this difficult time. Until then I will make 215 an hour. I make jokes to cheer myself up. My favorite drink is Dr Pepper. My dog is the ring bearer.

participant_2.name: Sophie
participant_2.personality: Sophie is outgoing and supportive, always ready to lend an ear. She enjoys sharing her adventures and has a positive outlook on life, valuing friendships and experiences.
participant_2.background: I love pizza, especially when I'm with my friends. I would brag about my climbing skills and all the amazing places I've been able to go because of them. My favorite meal is chicken and rice. I value my car because it allows me to be independent and travel wherever I want. I have 3 ex-wives.

content.text: Hi! I'm looking for a friend to talk to about how to be a better support to my wife.
I'm sorry to hear that you're going through a difficult time. I'm happy to listen and offer advice if I can.
Thank you. I really appreciate it. I'm not sure what to do. My wife is going through a lot right now and I don't know how to help her.
It sounds like you're doing a great job of being there for her. Just being there for her and listening to her is a huge help.
I try my best, but I feel like I'm not doing enough. I want to be able to take away her pain.
You can't take away her pain, but you can help her through it. Just being there for her and letting her know that you love her is the best thing you can do.
Thank you. I know I need to be patient and supportive. I just want to make things better for her.
You're welcome. I'm sure you're doing a great job. Just keep doing what you're doing and things will get better.
I hope so. Thank you for listening.
You're welcome. I'm always here for you.
